_header: This ender night / I saw a sight / A maid a cradel keep
Subjects: carols, lullaby; dialogues, Virgin and Christ
_description: The Complaint of the Child Jesus to his Mother — nine six-line stanzas (aabccb) and burden: ‘Lullay my chyld & wepe no more / Slepe & be now styll / The kyng of blys this fader ys / As it was hys wyll’

BodEngPoete1.First Lines: This endrys nyȝtI saw a syȝth…
BodEngPoete1.Last Lines: …þat deth it ysfor þe & many mo

CULAdd5943.Transcription:
Þys oþer nyȝthy say asyȝta mayde a cradel
                    kepelullay ȝe songe& seyde amongely stille my childe
                    & slepeHow scholde I slepey ma not for wepeO so sore y am by
                    goneSlepe y woldey may not for colde& cloþys hau y
                    noneffor Adams gultmankunde is y splylde& þat me rewyth
                    soreffor Adam & euey schal leue hereþtytty wynter &
                    more
CULAdd5943.Note:
3 stanzas, corresponding to 1, 2, 5 of Oxford,  Bodleian Library Eng. poet. e.1 (SC 29734);
                    alternate burden: ‘Lullay lullay thow lytil child slep & be wel stylle
                    / þe kynge of blys þy fader is as it was his
                    wille’.

BLAdd5666.First Lines:
This ender nithgtI sauy ha sithgtHa may ha credill
                    kepe…
BLAdd5666.Last Lines:
…Fadere ofe blysWartu þou hasForsaking me this
                    sone
BLAdd5666.Note: 6 stanzas, corresponding to 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 8 of Oxford,  Bodleian Library Eng. poet. e.1 (SC 29734).
